intro: Ovieda aculeata, commonly known as the spiny leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are thick and waxy, with sharp, pointed spines along the edges. Ovieda aculeata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
